text: Requirements for induction of vitamin D - mediated gene regulation in normal human B lymphocytes .

Mature human lymphocytes are unique targets of 1 alpha , 25-dihydroxyvitamin D3 ( 1 alpha , 25 ( OH ) 2D3 ) in that <extra_id_0> vitamin D receptors <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> VDR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) are not constitutively expressed , and specific cellular activation signals are required for both the up-regulation of <extra_id_0> VDR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and establishment of reactivity to the lipophilic ligand .

text: Treatment of B lymphocytes with the cytokine <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , in the absence of prior activation , induces a weak up-regulation of <extra_id_0> VDR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression but fails to generate vitamin D - responsive element ( VDRE ) - reactive nuclear protein complexes or to initiate the genomic transcription of <extra_id_0> 25-hydroxyvitamin D3 24-hydroxylase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Stimulation of B lymphocytes by either ligation of <extra_id_0> CD40 Ag <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or cross-linking the Ig receptor is also insufficient to render B lymphocytes responsive to 1 alpha , 25 ( OH ) 2D3 .

However , this apparent lack of response to the secosterol can be overcome by stimulation of B lymphocytes with a combination of these cellular activation signals , which are sufficient to lead to G1 cell cycle progression .

In the presence of 1 alpha , 25 ( OH ) 2D3 , cellular activation associated with stimulation of such a progression appears to be sufficient for the up-regulation of <extra_id_0> VDR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> message and protein and necessary for the establishment of VDRE binding complexes and the induction of <extra_id_0> 24-hydroxylase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> message .

text: Furthermore , biologic functions are modulated , in that the hormone inhibits proliferation in a subset of the activated B cells .
These observations suggest that reactivity to 1 alpha , 25 ( OH ) 2D3 is tightly regulated in B lymphocytes , requiring specific signals for its initiation .
